page.title: 10SANDFORD LIDO,CHELTENHAM
page.content: Sandford Lido was built in 1935,the pool being opened on Saturday,May 25th.On one side is the General Hospital and on the other side is Sandford Park through which the River Chelt flows.Sandford Park was opened in 1926 by the Duke and Duchess of Beaufort.The lido costs 50p for children and 80p for adults.On a very hot day the lido will take more than 500 people.The most there's ever been is about 5000 in a day. In 1972 a lower,safer chute was put in,slanted towards the shallow end.It took 8 months to build the lido and it cost Â£16,000.Sandford Lido has two pools.In the big pool there are three diving boards and two slides.The little pool has one slide.The pools are very popular with the people of Cheltenham and we all love going there in the summer when the water is really warm.
